HTML: What does a doctype do?: DOCTYPEs are required for legacy reasons. When omitted, browsers tend to use a different rendering mode that is incompatible with some specifications. Including the DOCTYPE in a document ensures that the browser makes a best-effort attempt at following the relevant specifications.

HTML: What does semantic mean to you: A semantic element clearly describes its meaning to both the browser and the developer. Examples of non-semantic elements: <div> and <span> - Tells nothing about its content. Examples of semantic elements: <form>, <table>, and <article> - Clearly defines its content.

HTML: When would you use a div tag vs se: The <div> element is often used as a container for other HTML elements to style them with CSS or to perform certain tasks with JavaScript.

CSS: What is the difference between clas: an ID can be used to identify one element, whereas a class can be used to identify more than one.

CSS: What are some ways that inline elem: Block level elements are usually higher order, parent elements in HTML

CSS: What are media queries?: Media queries are a CSS3 module allowing content rendering to adapt to conditions such as screen resolution (e.g. smartphone screen vs. computer screen).

CSS: What does `* { box-sizing: border-b: Width and height apply to all parts of all elements: content, padding and borders:

Git: What is Git and why should you use: Git is a version control system for tracking changes in computer files and coordinating work on those files among multiple people.

Git: What's the difference between Git a: Git is a revision control system, a tool to manage your source code history. GitHub is a hosting service for Git repositories.

What's the difference between JS and jQu: JavaScript is a scripting language which is used within a browser for interface interactions. JQuery is a library of Javascript that simplifies event handling, animations etc. The only difference is that jQuery has been optimized to perform many common scripting functions in fewer lines of codes.
